Value.label: 2. Basic Set Level
Value.Help: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. The 0xFF (255) means turn on the light. For dimmer equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength.

Value.label: 3. PIR Sensitivity
Value.Help: PIR sensitivity settings. 0 means disable the PIR motion. 1 means the lowest sensitivity. 99 means the highest sensitivity. High sensitivity means can detect long distance, but if there is more noise signal in the environment, it will re-trigger too frequently.

Value.label: 4. Light threshold
Value.Help: Setting the illummination threshold to turn on the light. When the event triggered and the environment illumination lower then the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 0 means turn off illumination detected function and never turn on the light. 1 means darkest. 99 means brightest. 100 means turn off illumination detected function. And always turn on the light. * Notice * in none test mode, only the value in 1 to 99 will enable the illumination detected function and update the illumination value.

Value.label: 5. Operation Mode
Value.Help: Bit 0: 1 means security mode; 0 means home automation mode. Bit 1: 1 means enable test mode; 0 means disable test mode * Notice * Bit 0 and bit 1 will effect when the DIP Switch setting to program mode. If bit1 is enabled, the bit0 is useless. Bit 2: Reserved, always 1. Bit 3: Setting the temperature scale; 0: Fahrenheit, 1:Celsius Bit 4: Disable illumination report after event triggered. Bit 5: Disable temperature report after event triggered

Value.label: 6. Multi-Sensor Function Switch
Value.Help: Multi-Sensor Function switch. Using bit to control. Bit 0: Reserved, always 1. Bit 1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination. Bit 2: Reserved, always 1. Bit 3: Reserved. Bit 4: Reserved. Bit 5: Reserved. Bit 6: Enable temperature monitoring. When this bit enabled, the temperature changed 3 degree Fahrenheit, it will report. And also the temperature over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will report every 64 seconds.

Value.label: 8. PIR re-detect interval time
Value.Help: In the security mode, after the PIR report motion detected, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 24 seconds, default tick is 3 (24 seconds). Setting the suitable value to prevent received the trigger signal too frequency. Also can save the battery energy. * Notice * If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR not detecting.

Value.label: 9. Turn Off Light Time
Value.Help: After turn on the light, setting the delay time to turn off the light when the PIR motion is not detected. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 32 seconds, default tick is 4 (32 seconds).

Value.label: 10. Auto Report Battery Time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the battery level. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.label: 12. Auto Report Illumination Time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the illumination. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.label: 13. Auto Report Temperature time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the temperature. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.Help: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. The 0xFF (255) means turn on the light. For dimmer equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength.

Bit 2: Reserved, always 1. Bit 3: Setting the temperature scale; 0: Fahrenheit, 1:Celsius Bit 4: Disable illumination report after event triggered. Bit 5: Disable temperature report after event triggered

Value.label: 6. Multi-Sensor Function Switch
Value.Help: Multi-Sensor Function switch. Using bit to control. Bit 0: Reserved, always 1. Bit 1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination. Bit 2: Reserved, always 1. Bit 3: Reserved. Bit 4: Reserved. Bit 5: Reserved. Bit 6: Enable temperature monitoring. When this bit enabled, the temperature changed 3 degree Fahrenheit, it will report. And also the temperature over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will report every 64 seconds.

Value.label: 8. PIR re-detect interval time
Value.Help: In the security mode, after the PIR report motion detected, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 24 seconds, default tick is 3 (24 seconds). Setting the suitable value to prevent received the trigger signal too frequency. Also can save the battery energy. * Notice * If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR not detecting.

Value.Help: After turn on the light, setting the delay time to turn off the light when the PIR motion is not detected. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 32 seconds, default tick is 4 (32 seconds).

Value.label: 10. Auto Report Battery Time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the battery level. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.label: 12. Auto Report Illumination Time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the illumination. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.label: 13. Auto Report Temperature time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto report the temperature. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

Value.label: Report type
Value.Help: Defines the contents of Multilevel Sensor Report after Multilevel Sensor Get received.

Value.label: Blinking behavior
Value.Help: This is actually a double byte value. The LSB defines the total time the device needs to blink in seconds. The MSB defines the on/off interval of the blink in tenths of seconds.

Value.label: Notification status
Value.Help: Enables automatic notifications to associated devices whenever there is a state change.

Value.label: Enable Wattage Reports
Value.Help: Enable/disable Wattage threshold and percent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold
Value.Help: The minimum change in wattage for a report to be sent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold percent
Value.Help: Minimum change in percent of wattage to send a report.

Value.label: Default Group Reports
Value.Help: Set report types for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default. Reverts to 0 after set.

Value.label: Report type G1
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 1. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC(KWH) bit 2 MRC(watt) bit 1 MSRC bit 0 reserved The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G2
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 2. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC(KWH) bit 2 MRC(watt) bit 1 MSRC bit 0 reserved The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G3
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 3. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC(KWH) bit 2 MRC(watt) bit 1 MSRC bit 0 reserved The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Default Group Time
Value.Help: Set time interval for sending reports for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Send interval G1
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 1 is sent.

Value.label: Send interval G2
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 2 is sent.

Value.label: Send interval G3
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 3 is sent.

Value.label: Device tag
Value.Help: Device tag.

Value.label: Reset device
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Mode
Value.Help: Enable selective Group Mode or Scene Mode when the Panic Button is in Use mode

Value.label: Reset configuration
Value.Help: Reset configuration set up to default setting
